abstract: Creates a new column of arrays of strings from a given column whose elements can be converted to an array of strings.

codeExamples.code:
let stringArrayString = "[\"Array\", \"of\", \"strings\", \"1\"]"
let stringArrayString2 = "[\"Array\", \"of\", \"strings\", \"2\"]"
let stringsColumn = MLDataColumn([stringArrayString, stringArrayString2])

print(stringsColumn) // Prints ["["Array", "of", "strings", "1"]", "["Array", "of", "strings", "2"]"]

let stringArrayColumn = MLDataColumn<[String]>(column: stringsColumn)
print(stringArrayColumn) // Prints [["Array", "of", "strings", "1"], ["Array", "of", "strings", "2"]]

overview:
## Discussion

Use this initializer to create a column of arrays of strings from another column. Start by creating a column that is convertible to a column of arrays of strings.

Then use [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataColumn/init(column:)-8uzuq] to convert the column to a column of arrays of strings.

# init(column:)

**Initializer**

Creates a new column of arrays of strings from a given column whose elements can be converted to an array of strings.

## Declaration

```swift
init<T>(column: MLDataColumn<T>) where T : MLDataValueConvertible
```

## Parameters

- **column**: An [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataColumn] of elements convertible to an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Array] of [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/String].

## Discussion

Use this initializer to create a column of arrays of strings from another column. Start by creating a column that is convertible to a column of arrays of strings.

```swift
let stringArrayString = "[\"Array\", \"of\", \"strings\", \"1\"]"
let stringArrayString2 = "[\"Array\", \"of\", \"strings\", \"2\"]"
let stringsColumn = MLDataColumn([stringArrayString, stringArrayString2])

print(stringsColumn) // Prints ["["Array", "of", "strings", "1"]", "["Array", "of", "strings", "2"]"]
```

Then use [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataColumn/init(column:)-8uzuq] to convert the column to a column of arrays of strings.

```swift
let stringArrayColumn = MLDataColumn<[String]>(column: stringsColumn)
print(stringArrayColumn) // Prints [["Array", "of", "strings", "1"], ["Array", "of", "strings", "2"]]
```

## Creating a data column by converting another column

- **map(to:)**: Creates a new column by converting this column to the given type.
- **init(column:)**: Creates a new column of machine learning sequences from a given column whose elements can be converted to sequences.
- **init(column:)**: Creates a new column of integers from a given column whose elements can be converted to integers.
- **init(column:)**: Creates a new column of arrays of integers from a given column whose elements can be converted to an array of integers.
- **init(column:)**: Creates a new column of doubles from a given column whose elements can be converted to doubles.
- **init(column:)**: Creates a new column of arrays of doubles from a given column whose elements can be converted to an array of doubles.
- **init(column:)**: Creates a new column of strings from a given column whose elements can be converted to strings.
- **init(column:)**: Creates a new column of machine learning sequences from a given column whose elements can be converted to sequences.
- **init(column:)**: Creates a new column of machine learning dictionaries from a given column whose elements can be converted to dictionaries.
